name: Eruch
startIntroPart1: The Eruch Empire began as a series of impassioned debates between long established noble families about the growing chaos in the world and what could be done to stop it. The debates soon reached a critical mass for action, fueled by the nobles’ fear of an uncertain future as well as their desire to protect their wealth. A secret council was formed, drawing on the leadership and military prowess that had been their inheritance from previous generations. It mobilized a small but well-equipped army. With it, the nobles carved out a large territory that would become the core of Eruch, and seceded from the old kingdoms.
startIntroPart2: Outwardly, leaders of Eruch profess the glories of civilized life, and seek to spread their ways to the ends of the earth. They act as gentlemen in diplomatic affairs, but always have a rigid structure of military might ready to respond at their first call.
declaringWar: I'm afraid I must take by force what is mine and what is yours as well... Hopefully you will show yourself to be a worthy opponent.
attacked: Ah, ah! Well, I cannot argue with your decision, but I believe you have made a grave mistake.
defeated: I tip my hat to you, sir, for you have shown a worthy opponent. Enjoy your victory while you still can.
introduction: Ah, salutations. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Cyrus Rotheram of Eruch, known for our great military might. I hope you to be a valuable ally, or I shall judge you a worthy foe.
tradeRequest: It would be in your best interest, to carefully consider this proposal.

name: Dalmace
startIntroPart1: Dalmace arose out of necessity. The turmoil of old kingdoms collapsing and new empires emerging left many people of the lower and middle classes marginalized. Some stayed in their homelands but many fled as refugees, not knowing where to go. They gathered in the country estates of nobles that did not have the heart or the force to deny their presence. Soon leaders arose from the ranks of the refugees, calling for organization, protection, food, and resources. Some nobles saw opportunity and joined their ranks, sharing their wealth. Others refused, and their estates were ransacked. These were the first Dalmace compounds, which would grow into cities that rivaled those of any other empire.
startIntroPart2: Dalmace is founded on ideals, and its strength comes from the tight camaraderie and evolving culture of its humble citizens.
declaringWar: I'm afraid I must take by force what is mine and what is yours as well... Hopefully you will show yourself to be a worthy opponent.
attacked: Ah, ah! Well, I cannot argue with your decision, but I believe you have made a grave mistake.
defeated: Goodness, this is gratuitous injustice! Dalmacia may disappear from the charts, but she will live forever in the hearts of commoners.
introduction: It is splendid to meet you, sir, simply splendid! Welcome to humble Dalmacia. My name is Clinton Alderdice, and I am pleased to give you my hand in friendship.
tradeRequest: Dalmace offers you this exceptional proposition.
uniques: [-10]% Culture cost of adopting new Policies

name: Orlin
startIntroPart1: The steady advance of science brought great changes to the processes by which products were manufactured, transported, and sold. Many otherwise shrewd businessmen could not contend with the changes and faded away, leaving room for the more adaptable. Orlin had no political existence when it began, and no desire for empire. It was a collection of ambitious industrialist that banded together for mutual benefit. They parceled out markets like territories, and together came to dominate industries throughout the old kingdoms.
startIntroPart2: When the kingdoms began to fade, the Orlin tycoons clashed in a contest for power. They encroached on each other’s ventures, and delved into blackmail and assassination. A tight oligarchy emerged which controlled nearly all the means of production. With their industrial capacity, and the riches it brought, they formally entered the world stage as an empire.
declaringWar: I'm afraid I must take by force what is mine and what is yours as well... Hopefully you will show yourself to be a worthy opponent.
attacked: Ah, ah! Well, I cannot argue with your decision, but I believe you have made a grave mistake.
defeated: You, sir, are a scoundrel. Go ahead and take our factories, but know that, in your hands, the world will never know true greatness under industry.
introduction: Behold the greatest cog in the industrial machine, the nation of Orlin! I am Ignace Curnow, and shall warn you, sir, that any foolery shall be dealt with severely. My time is of great value.
tradeRequest: How would you like it if I propose this kind of exchange?

name: Pulias
startIntroPart1: The exact origins of Pulias are shrouded in mystery even to this day. It seems to have emerged out of nowhere, yet its power and wealth seem too large to have been easily missed. Most sources posit a single leader who saw the opportunities of new science, commerce, and most of all politics, and manipulated affairs from the shadows. This leader sold sensitive information to rivals at a premium while using it to further the objectives of Pulias.
startIntroPart2: In the early competition between empires, many opportunities were left unexplored as rivals focused on short-term gains. Pulias was the first to send expeditions to foreign lands, and established trade that brought riches to its citizens. Its spies were placed in key positions across the world, gathering intelligence and ready to act.
declaringWar: I'm afraid I must take by force what is mine and what is yours as well... Hopefully you will show yourself to be a worthy opponent.
attacked: Ah, ah! Well, I cannot argue with your decision, but I believe you have made a grave mistake.
defeated: I bow to you, sir, for your splendid victory. My nation has risen quietly, but, as the world well knows, her fall has been loud on the contrary.
introduction: Come, my good friend, let us have a chat. My name is Octavius Cutler of Pulias, perhaps you have heard of me? No matter. Please, tell me about you and your great deeds.
tradeRequest: Would you be interested in a trade agreement with Pulias?

name: Vedria
startIntroPart1: When the old kingdoms weakened, the growing class of academics and inventors saw the opportunity to create a new kind of nation, one that was founded on principles of reason and embraced scientific advancement. They found allies in many of the old monarchists, who were looking for a way to preserve their influence, and together they became Vedria. Their ranks mixed quickly, and before long every prominent leader was expected to be familiar with scientific processes, if not involved in research personally.
startIntroPart2: Vedria is marked by optimism for the future to come, and its citizens believe that the noble pursuit of science is the clear path towards it. Scientists are consulted on matters of state, and given generous for their research.
declaringWar: I'm afraid I must take by force what is mine and what is yours as well... Hopefully you will show yourself to be a worthy opponent.
attacked: Ah, ah! Well, I cannot argue with your decision, but I believe you have made a grave mistake.
defeated: Well met, sir. I hope you continue your quest for knowledge and invention in my absence.
introduction: I say, it is a pleasure to meet you! I am Luther Griggs, inventor extraordinaire, leader of Vedria! Let us share our knowledge in the spirit of science and friendship.
tradeRequest: My friend, it is my belief that this settlement can benefit both our peoples.
uniques: [+25]% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital

name: Milan
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: You fiend! History shall remember this!

name: Florence
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: And so the flower of Florence falls to barbaric hands...

name: Rio de Janeiro
declaringWar: I have to do this, for the sake of progress if nothing else. You must be opposed!
attacked: You can see how fruitless this will be for you... right?
defeated: May God grant me these last wishes - peace and prosperity for Brazil.

name: Antwerp
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: They will write songs of this.... pray that they shall be in your favor.

name: Tyre
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: We never fully trusted you from the start.

name: Ur
declaringWar: I will enjoy hearing your last breath as you witness the destruction of your realm!
attacked: Why do we fight' Because Inanna demands it. Now, witness the power of the Sumerians!
defeated: What treachery has struck us? No, what evil?

name: Genoa
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: How barbaric. Those who live by the sword shall perish by the sword.

name: Venice
declaringWar: You have revealed your purposes a bit too early, my friend...
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: A wrong calculation, on my part.

name: Brussels
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: I guess you weren't here for the sprouts after all...

name: Kabul
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Unacceptable!

name: Singapore
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Perhaps, in another world, we could have been friends...

name: Zanzibar
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: May the Heavens forgive you for inflicting this humiliation to our people.

name: Sydney
declaringWar: After thorough deliberation, Australia finds itself at a crossroads. Prepare yourself, for war is upon us.
attacked: We will mobilize every means of resistance to stop this transgression against our nation!
defeated: The principles for which we have fought will survive longer than any nation you could ever build.

name: Cape Town
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: I have failed. May you, at least, know compassion towards our people.

name: Kathmandu
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: We... defeated? No... we had so much work to do!

name: Hanoi
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: So this is how it feels to die...

name: Quebec City
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: We were too weak to protect ourselves...

name: Helsinki
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: The day of judgement has come to us. But rest assured, the same will go for you!

name: Kuala Lumpur
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Today, the Malay people obey you, but do not think this is over...

name: Manila
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Ah, Gods! Why have you forsaken us?

name: Lhasa
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Perhaps now we will find peace in death...

name: Vancouver
declaringWar: In responding to the unstinting malignancy that has heretofore defined your relationship with Canada, we can have no recourse but war!
attacked: As we can reach no peaceful resolution with you, Canada must turn, with reluctance, to war.
defeated: I regret not defending my country to the last, although it was not of use.

name: Mogadishu
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Congratulations, conquerer. This tribe serves you now.
